Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style or Grand Style, pottery heavy chalice with handle root; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with added white band; exterior: part of handle frill pattern; below, two bands, much worn; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The thickness and size of the sherd suggest that the vase was a heavy chalice. The sherd joins British Museum 1965,0930.169, which joins British Museum 1888,0601.193. 1965,0930.19 and 171 are probably from the same chalice.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1622) (phase 2)
